author: Staff Reporter
text:
The TMC leader wants Centre to lift the stay

Tamil Maanila Congress (TMC) president G.K. Vasan on Tuesday termed the Supreme Court’s order banning jallikattu disappointing and demanded the Union government to take steps to lift the stay.

Talking to reporters after a meeting party functionaries at Thiruchitrambalam in Vanur, Mr. Vasan urged the State government to put pressure on the Centre to take steps to secure the release of 114 fishermen lodged in Sri Lankan prisons.

Fishermen arrest

Incidents of arrest of Indian fishermen are continuing unabated, he said, adding that the TMC would stage an agitation in Chennai on January 18 seeking the immediate release of fishermen and their boats.

Alliance issue

Mr. Vasan said his party would not be part of any alliance headed by the BJP for the forthcoming Assembly elections.

“The TMC would disclose its stand at the right time,” said Mr. Vasan.

He also demanded Kerala government to rescind its decision to open a new police station near the site of Mullaperiyar dam.
title: SC order on jallikattu disappointing: Vasan
